abstracts.cdata!:
The physical implementation of the main
            project components is rated atisfactory and the
            project's objectives were supported by what progress
            the government made on industry reform. Project
            sustainability is uncertain due to external factors
            including delays in the liberalization of coffee marketing.
            World Bank and Borrower performances are rated overall as
            satisfactory. Key lessons learned include the following:
            Conditionalities were not included in designing the project
            to address some of the wider and possibly contentious policy
            issues facing industry reform today. However, it is
            acknowledged that the political nature of these problems
            could have pre-empted the entire project and sacrificed the
            achievements gained under the project at the producer and
            processing level. Delegating project supervision to the Bank
            team located in the field was desirable for ensuring timely
            client service during project start-up, clearance of bidding
            documents, processing of disbursement requests and
            implementation adjustments to the project in response to the
            changes facing the coffee industry. After financing by the
            Commonwealth Development Corporation was withdrawn, the
            project should have found a way to support through financial
            and technical assistance the increasingly important small
            estate sub-sector. On revising the project risks at
            appraisal, it proved essential that adopting an improved
            payment system was a condition of effectiveness.
